author: HarleyMeenen
title: Great Durability
review:
There is admittedly not much to this set, as it's one of the smaller ones in the line. There is an ice cream cart, which adds a simple but nice touch. Next is a photo booth with an attached camera. I haven't yet put the stickers on, and I suspect it would look much better with them. Overall, though, there's really not much to say about the side builds.

The main feature is, of course, the space ride itself. The build is quick and a bit repetitive, especially with building the rocket cars, but they're easy and fast enough that I didn't really mind.

I was worried that the ride would not really work, but was definitely wrong. My first instinct to test my fear was to violently spin the ride with a mini-doll seated in it. And it worked brilliantly. The figure stayed perfectly in place rather than flying out as I expected. The arms work as intended, with the ships lifting at higher angles as the speed increased.

This set is a perfect depiction of a classic ride, and I couldn't be happier with it.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Awesome Amusement Park Fun at Great Value
review:
Set #41128 Amusement Park Space Ride: Fans of amusement parks will enjoy the diversity found in the LEGO Friends Amusement Park Sub-Theme, what’s more this set is currently at Costco for a very good price, only 13$, which is a great deal for holiday shoppers. Classic Space fans might not appreciate the colours, but the logo is used quite effectively for this type of ride.

Box/Instructions

Box: This is a standard LEGO Friends box design, I have discussed it quite often in the past. The big difference from past boxes is the use of some nice amusement park themed lighting and trim at the top of the box including the look of the Friends characters to match their available costumes in this sub-theme. This is a really fun box design, much more than past Friends boxes.

Instructions: Here we find the standard looking instruction manual from LEGO Friends, this one has easy to follow build steps and includes some nice imagery for this particular Sub-Theme of LEGO Friends, the artwork in back for the Amusement Park sets is very nice. There’s also a checklist for the LEGO Elves sets released at the same time on the inside back cover.

This set includes a sticker sheet, mine was curled due to the nature of the storage. I advise caution as this could spread to sticker sheets with creases or tears in them due to the nature of the loose sheet.

Parts

There are quite a number of common parts for LEGO Friends in this set, however the biggest draw for this particular set when it comes to the parts are the three new Technic axle connectors designed specifically for the Amusement Park Space Ride, the attach to separate axles on either end and have a floppy joint in between to simulate the effects of the ride. Overall a great new part with a ton of uses.

Mini-Doll

Olivia: It’s nice to see Olivia again, this version is dressed in a tasteful looking teal skirt with a matching pair of shoes. Her top features magenta and white stripes and she looks quite nice, I will admit though I do wish that the characters might get different hair pieces sometimes for unique appearances. She pretty much looks the same here like any other Olivia Mini-Doll. No unique-to-her accessories either, not even a pair of sunglasses to affix to the top of her hair, unfortunately.

The build

Bag 1: Olivia gets to experience the fun of helping you build the ice-cream stand, the photo stand and the central portion of the main ride. This build will include sticker placement, the only tricky portion of the build in my opinion is lining up the stickers just right to adhere properly to the parts. It was a very satisfying and enjoyable build for this set, the little ice cream freezer thing was fun to build too and helps to add another level of playability.

Bag 2: This portion of the build is highly repetitive, in this bag is the main rockets of the space ride. Each one is built the exact same way, and once again there is a lot of sticker placement here which can be tricky, but it’s a fast build once you get to understand the steps and also quite fun to finish off the ride and watch it all come together.

The completed model

Space Ride: This thing is loaded with charm and enjoyable nods to LEGO’s Classic Space era, in fact all of the markings on the rockets themselves are stickers with the Classic Space logo on it. This model would even look good in a LEGO City Amusement Park, despite some of the traditional LEGO Friends colours Amusement Parks are known for their colorful appearances after all.

The play feature to spin the ride is very simple and very well executed. The sticker detailing on the ride itself are slightly reflective and show stars and other space elements. The new connection piece is a godsend here as it allows the three rockets to spin and ride up and down.

Ice Cream Stand & Commemorative Photo Booth: These additional models include more play value, there is a large commemorative photo booth with a camera attached to the top and angled to face the ride to catch the riders as they spin around in a circle. The model is fairly simply build and looks like what you’d find at an amusement park.

The Ice Cream ‘Stand’ is more of a simple push cart freezer, not an actual stand, I’m guilty a bit of fudging the name a little to make it simpler. It’s a simple little build too and uses some parts to great effect. Pop open the door and you can claim a Popsicle or a scoop of chocolate ice cream. Two cones are attached to the outside, one of them already adorned with strawberry flavored ice cream.

These two little models offer more to do with the set.

Overall opinion

I love this set, it’s a great model and includes some really fun building techniques to achieve what it needs. The introduction of a new piece helps enhance the playability of this set, and that playability is very fun. You can spin the space ride around and around or let go and watch it spin after twisting it.

The current price at Costco of 13$ is a great value for this set, I find myself tempted to get a few more for the parts alone. Perhaps if time allows. I very strongly recommend picking this set up if you haven’t done so already, it is a great little set and this entire Sub-Theme is brilliant. LEGO Friends continues not to disappoint.
